title: Looking for expensive-looking typeface
content:
Hello everyone,

I searched through the Typophile and found the “Luxury” font collection by OrangeItalic. I think they are pretty close to what I’m looking for. What other fonts do you think exemplify “luxe.”

(And by “luxe,” I refer to middle-aged/golfer/CEO-with-a-private-jet kind of luxe. Like Trump but with more class.)

Any suggestions are truly appreciated!

 [‹ Helvetica: The Film](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202192942/http:/www.typophile.com/node/27479 "Go to previous forum topic") [Dalton Maag call for EULA opinions ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202192942/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36663 "Go to next forum topic")
author: mauphie

comments.content:
Bickham Script  
Engravers Script  
Engravers Gothic  
Sackers  
Bodoni  
Young Baroque  
Optima

Faces associated with engraving, things with fine lines in them such as Baroque faces like Bodoni.

Hoefler & Frere-Jones’s Didot cut.  
Doesn’t get more upperclass than that.  
We are talking high-couture;o)

I knew there had been a previous post about this.

Thanks for all the suggestions. Definitely looking for a serif or sans—ruled out all scripts.

Thanks

Happy Friday!

Carlton from Letraset is always good for this
